0.label: Apple Scab
0.advice: Use organic fungicide and maintain leaf hygiene.

1.label: Apple with Black Rot
1.advice: Remove infected fruits and apply copper-based sprays.

2.label: Cedar Apple Rust
2.advice: Remove nearby cedar trees and apply protective fungicide.

5.label: Cherry with Powdery Mildew
5.advice: Apply sulfur-based fungicide and ensure proper spacing.

7.label: Corn (Maize) with Cercospora and Gray Leaf Spot
7.advice: Remove infected leaves, rotate crops, and use fungicides.

8.label: Corn (Maize) with Common Rust
8.advice: Apply resistant varieties and use fungicide if severe.

9.label: Corn (Maize) with Northern Leaf Blight
9.advice: Remove infected debris, apply fungicide as needed.

11.label: Grape with Black Rot
11.advice: Prune infected parts and apply fungicide regularly.

12.label: Grape with Esca (Black Measles)
12.advice: Remove infected vines and improve air circulation.

13.label: Grape with Isariopsis Leaf Spot
13.advice: Spray fungicide and remove infected leaves.

15.label: Orange with Citrus Greening
15.advice: Remove infected trees and control psyllid insects.

16.label: Peach with Bacterial Spot
16.advice: Spray copper-based bactericide and remove infected leaves.

18.label: Bell Pepper with Bacterial Spot
18.advice: Remove infected fruits and apply copper sprays.

20.label: Potato with Early Blight
20.advice: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicide regularly.

21.label: Potato with Late Blight
21.advice: Use resistant varieties and apply appropriate fungicides.

25.label: Squash with Powdery Mildew
25.advice: Apply sulfur or potassium bicarbonate sprays.

26.label: Strawberry with Leaf Scorch
26.advice: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicide.

28.label: Tomato with Bacterial Spot
28.advice: Remove infected leaves and apply copper sprays.

29.label: Tomato with Early Blight
29.advice: Use resistant varieties and rotate crops.

30.label: Tomato with Late Blight
30.advice: Apply fungicide and remove infected plants.

31.label: Tomato with Leaf Mold
31.advice: Improve air circulation and apply fungicide.

32.label: Tomato with Septoria Leaf Spot
32.advice: Remove infected leaves and use fungicide.

33.label: Tomato with Spider Mites or Two-spotted Spider Mite

34.label: Tomato with Target Spot
34.advice: Apply fungicide and remove infected leaves.

35.label: Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
35.advice: Control whiteflies and remove infected plants.

36.label: Tomato Mosaic Virus
36.advice: Use resistant varieties and remove infected plants.
